Hormuz, the world's oil chokepoint, is under tension
subhead: A blockade of the strait, through which one-fifth of global oil consumption passes, would have a catastrophic impact on the world economy. Iran, which depends on its oil revenues, has much to lose, as does China, its main customer.

French government orders recall of all at-risk vehicles with Takata airbags
subhead: The transport minister has expanded measures to protect drivers from accidental explosions of defective Takata airbags. Some 2.5 million vehicles are now affected, and among them, 1.7 million have been banned from being driven.

headline: Trump's opposition faces another adversary: The 'rally around the flag' phenomenon
subhead: The US president's decision to lead his country into war with Iran could spark a wave of unity around him, observes Corine Lesnes in her column.

headline: In China, the Labubu craze has electrified the toy industry
subhead: Created by a Beijing-based company, manufactured in China and sold via vending machines, these collectible figurines delight Gen Z and are flying off the shelves abroad.

headline: France's new flag war: The Israeli and Palestinian banners on town halls
subhead: Several towns have been ordered to take down the Israeli or Palestinian flags raised by their mayors, in the name of the neutrality of public service.

The three lives of NATO, born from a gamble, now deemed obsolete by Trump
subhead: Created out of America's desire to protect Europe from communism, the North Atlantic Alliance underwent profound changes after the fall of the Berlin Wall. It expanded and took on new missions, though it never fully proved its effectiveness. Today, it faces fierce challenges from Donald Trump.

headline: 'They come in vans and arrest mothers': Fear of immigration raids grips Chicago
subhead: In Chicago, another sanctuary city targeted by Donald Trump, residents have been organizing to thwart arrests by federal immigration agents and protect the country's second-largest Mexican community, after Los Angeles.

headline: Venice locals protest Jeff Bezos's three-day wedding extravaganza
subhead: Residents of La Serenissima have formed a group to oppose the wedding of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sanchez, who have planned a ceremony set to take place between Thursday and Saturday.
